text: Rogelio Bautista Martínez Ulloa (November 5, 1918 - May 24, 2010) was a pitcher in Major League Baseball who played briefly for the Washington Senators during the season. Listed at , 180 lb., Martínez batted and threw right-handed. He was born in Cidra, Matanzas Province, Cuba. Martínez was nicknamed Limonar, after the modest little town in his native Matanzas where he started to play baseball. In one major league season, Martínez posted a 0–1 record with a 27.00 ERA in two appearances, including one start, giving up four runs on four hits and two walks while striking out none in 1.1 innings of work. Martínez died at the age of 91 after suffering an internal hemorrhage after a fall. ==See also== *1950 Washington Senators season *List of Major League Baseball players from Cuba ==External links== *Retrosheet Category:1918 births Category:2010 deaths Category:Accidental deaths from falls Category:Accidental deaths in Connecticut Category:Angeles de Puebla players Category:Caribbean Series players Category:Havana Cubans players Category:Major League Baseball pitchers Category:Major League Baseball players from Cuba Category:Mexican League baseball pitchers Category:México Azul players Category:Shelby Clippers players Category:Sportspeople from New London, Connecticut Category:Tampa Smokers players Category:Tigres del México players Category:Washington Senators (1901–1960) players Category:Williamsport Grays players
title: Rogelio Martínez (baseball)
